body:
## Expected Behavior
Golang Vulnerability CVE-2021-39293 is not present in Temporal binaries such as temporal-server. Apparently this is fixed in Golang v1.16.8, and 1.17.1.

## Actual Behavior
Golang Vulnerability CVE-2021-39293 is present in Temporal binaries such as temporal-server. Details of vulnerability here, https://github.com/golang/go/issues/47801

## Steps to Reproduce the Problem

1. Deploy Temporal Server using temporal-server or temporal-auto-setup container images from https://hub.docker.com/u/temporalio
2. Run a container image vulnerability scan (e.g. Twistlock) on the image from 1.

## Specifications

  - Version: Have tested v1.11.4, v1.12.4, v1.13.1
  - Platform: Tested on linuxamd64

comments.body: Hi! does this impact v13.1 of temporal? Description may have stated however it's not clear to me, thanks.

Thanks for the bug report.  We looked into it and we don't use any of the vulnerable code, so we'll be putting out an update to fix this in the next month.  

And yes, @ah-eng, this does include v1.13.1.

Thanks for actioning this. Do you also do backports? Any chance you are able to rebuild a previous release with the patched golang version. E.g. https://github.com/temporalio/temporal/blob/d7f852a570b4b1675bafb3e6ff6a6531add036fe/.github/workflows/goreleaser.yml#L17 to go-version: 1.16.12?
golang 1.17.6 is used for temporal server 1.13, 1.14 and 1.15.

title: Golang Vulnerability CVE-2021-39293 in Temporal base-builder image
